lead_paragraph: Tiger Woods called for tough penalties on golf-doping cheats and said the public dishonor would be severe for violating the new testing program set to start in 2008. Speaking in a conference call in Montreal for the Presidents Cup, Woods made his first public comments on the program announced last week by the PGA. “I believe that it has to be somewhat significant because the sport has been traditionally about honor,” Woods said. “And I think that someone who breaks that code of ethic in our sport should be penalized.”.
